page.title: 03Local History
page.content: In 1932 Welling High Street was very narrow.There were very few cars then, but today there are traffic jams.There were fewer houses on one side of Welling Way and Bellegrove Road.There were only two main roads:Welling Way and Bellegrove Road,and no sideroads.The shops were planned but not built. The milkman brought milk by horsecart but today he uses an electric van.To buy food and other things you walked to Welling.Ice-cream was brought by a man on a threewheeler cart.Now he uses a motorised van which plays a tune. People moved into the area in 1932 for the same reasons they do today-to get bigger houses and gardens in a quiet pleasant area near to London.
